qas.question: How high was public faith in the monarchy when King George assumed the throne?
What position did George Hardie hold?
In what year did George Hardie become a member of Parliament?
In what year did the war end?
In what year did George VI write a letter to his brother Edward saying he assumed "a rocking throne"?

context: In the words of <a1_0>Labour Member of Parliament<a1_0/> <b6_0>George Hardie<b6_0/>, the abdication crisis of <b3_0><b4_0><b5_0>1936<b5_0/><b4_0/><b3_0/> did "more for republicanism than fifty years of propaganda". George VI wrote to his brother <a2_0>Edward<a2_0/> that in the aftermath of the abdication he had reluctantly assumed "a rocking throne", and tried "to make it steady again". He became king at a point when public faith in the monarchy was at a <a0_0>low<a0_0/> ebb. During his reign his people endured the hardships of war, and imperial power was eroded. However, as a dutiful family man and by showing personal courage, he succeeded in restoring the popularity of the monarchy.
